content: Running is the action of rapidly propelling yourself forward on foot. When running, there is a moment where both feet are off of the ground (as opposed to walking, when one foot is always on the ground), making it a high-impact exercise.
Move at a regular pace by lifting and setting down each foot in turn, never having both feet off the ground at once.
Propelling oneself on a bicycle using the feet and legs.
Hiking is a long, vigorous walk, usually on trails or footpaths in the countryside.
A form of cardio exercise, inline skating is also good for building strength endurance, especially in your thighs and glutes.
An exercise where the purpose is to strengthen the back muscles that draw the rower's arms toward the body.
The propulsion of the body through water by combined arm and leg motions and the natural flotation of the body.
Water aerobics is a form of aerobic exercise that requires water-immersed participants.
Hold a dumbbell with your palm facing upward. Slowly curl the weight up by bending your elbow.
While seated, you pull a hanging bar toward you to reach chin level, then release it back up with control for one repetition.
Hips hinge backward to lower down and pick up a weighted barbell or kettlebell from the floor.
Suspension training that uses body weight exercises to develop strength, balance, flexibility and core stability simultaneously.
Bending at the knee, lower to a position in which the torso is erect and the knees are deeply bent and then rises to an upright position.
In a seated position, repeatedly press your feet against weights, which can be adjusted according to your fitness level.
Sit with a weighted pad on top of your lower legs then use your quads to repeatedly extend your knees and lift your lower legs.
Bend your knees and move your heels toward your glutes while the rest of your body stays still. Typically done with added weights for resistance.
A bodyweight exercise that targets the muscle groups in your lower legs.
From a seated position, bring your feet back, so your heels are behind your knees. Lift your heels up off the floor, coming up on to your toes.
Lay on a bench and press weight upward using either a barbell or a pair of dumbbells.
A variation of the standard bench press that is performed by lying on a flat bench with a weight in each hand.
In a prone position, palms planted below the shoulders, balls of feet on the floor, push the body up and let it down by straightening and bending the arms.
An upper body strength training movement, traditionally performed with dumbbells or a barbell.
While keeping your legs straight, lift your legs a couple inches off the ground, and point your toes away from your body.
An isolation exercise that mainly targets your low back.
Extend or hip joint so that the angle between the pelvis and thigh increases.
A squat movement that's performed on only one leg.
Using physical postures, breathing exercises, and meditation to improve overall health.
Step forward, lower the body toward the ground, and return to the starting position.
Hip flexion happens every time you step, squat, sit, and revolve on a bike.
Knee flexion is a movement that decreases the angle between your thigh and your shin.
The knee extension is an exercise you can do with a weight machine to work the muscle on the front of the thigh.
Side leg raises is a core and leg exercise that involves you lying on the floor on your side, and abducting your leg (pushing them) away from the midline
Movement of the foot in a downward motion away from the body.
